description.narrative: 1. Project: 11876 Dream School Project Phase II#2. Project area and Country: Battambang province, Cambodia#3. Project justification: #The Dream School project extension builds on the successes and lessons learnt of a pilot phase implemented from July 2016 until December 2017 in Battambang province. Access to quality education is constrained by a number of factors in the four targeted communities. School infrastructure is in need of upgrading, and the schools do not provide a safe or supportive learning envi ronment for the children. Some of the schools have high student-teacher ratios with up to 40-50 children in one classroom, while teachers are not aware of the contents of the curriculum and do not master effective teaching methods, and lack motivation and commitment. Also, community commitment to education and cooperation between parents and schools has been identified as one of the key problems. #4. The main objective and expected results: #The main objective of the project is to contribute to children and adolescents improved learning outcomes and life opportunities. The project aims to enhance the skills and capacity of the 85 targeted teachers, 85 teacher trainers and 4 school directors in school management and teaching. Four targeted schools will have a safer and more supportive learning and teaching environment for all learners and teaching staff. The project will promote the engagement and commitment by parents and the local communities to participate in the development and management of schools and th eir activities. It will also seek to address the issue of girls dropping out of school early through the student council. #5. Right-holders/ beneficiaries: 1774 (children, teachers, school directors, librarians and school support committees members) #Duty bearers: parents, teachers, school directors, District Office of Education/Provincial Office of Education#6. Implementing partner: Puthi Kumar Organization (PKO)
